loc.EN:
The 5.8×21mm is a Chinese armor-piercing cartridge for handguns and submachine guns. The cartridge was designed for replacements of 7.62×25mm Tokarev-chambered small arms for the People's Liberation Army that would offer a wound as large as a standard 9×19mm Parabellum round. This round is offered in both a standard, and subsonic version. Both the QSZ-92 service pistol and the QCW-05 submachine gun are produced in this caliber as well as 9×19mm Parabellum. The 5.8×21mm is considerably less powerful than similar Western PDW cartridges like the 5.7×28mm and 4.6×30mm. It has a steel-cored 3 g (46 gr) projectile that has a muzzle velocity of 530 m/s (1,700 ft/s) and muzzle energy of 420 J (310 ft x lb) from a submachine gun barrel. The round can penetrate 1.3 mm (0.051 in) of helmet steel plate, and 50 mm (2.0 in) of pine wood behind it, out to 100 meters.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/5.8%C3%9721mm
